text: Pioneer Hall is a historic school building in Pleasant Hill, Tennessee, U.S.. It was built for the American Missionary Association from 1887 to 1889, and designed by Reverend Benjamin Dodge, a Congregationalist from Maine. It has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since November 21, 1978. It is now known as the Pioneer Hall Museum. ==References== Category:School buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in Tennessee Category:School buildings completed in 1889 Category:Museums in Cumberland County, Tennessee Category:American Missionary Association
title: Pioneer Hall (Pleasant Hill, Tennessee)
